# Readme
`r Sys.Date()`  



# install `kyoboLT` package


```r
devtools::install_github("lovetoken/kyoboLT")
```

# Useful functions for time series data

## `Xday_returns()` function


```r
index <- matrix(rnorm(60,1000, 8^2), 20, 3)
data <- xts(round(index, 1), as.Date(16001:16020)) # xts package for time series data
names(data) <- paste("Fund", 1:3, sep="_")
data
```

```
##            Fund_1 Fund_2 Fund_3
## 2013-10-23 1113.1  891.1  953.5
## 2013-10-24 1090.9  954.0  928.1
## 2013-10-25  900.6 1058.2 1057.2
## 2013-10-26  889.1  932.3  912.1
## 2013-10-27  942.9  993.3  963.3
## 2013-10-28 1037.8  929.8 1104.2
## 2013-10-29 1020.5 1047.4  952.1
## 2013-10-30 1040.8 1092.6 1129.6
## 2013-10-31  917.1  930.3  978.9
## 2013-11-01  968.0  937.3 1069.5
## 2013-11-02 1047.0  876.9  927.7
## 2013-11-03 1087.4  996.6 1004.3
## 2013-11-04 1001.2  996.1 1026.2
## 2013-11-05 1006.1 1035.4 1054.5
## 2013-11-06 1056.2  946.3  937.0
## 2013-11-07  969.2 1055.5 1066.0
## 2013-11-08 1055.6 1030.9 1070.4
## 2013-11-09 1042.0  993.4  985.4
## 2013-11-10 1050.1  950.8  948.8
## 2013-11-11  928.0  906.6 1023.4
```

```r
# basic 3 day returns
Xday_returns(data, Xday=3)
```

```
##                  Fund_1        Fund_2      Fund_3

## 2013-10-24           NA            NA          NA
```

```r
# calculation 3 day log returns
Xday_returns(data, Xday=3, log.returns = T)
```


## `tmplot()` function


```r
library("quantmod")
data <- getSymbols("^ks11", from=Sys.Date()-1000, to=Sys.Date(), auto.assign=F)

tmplot(data)
```

<img src="figure/unnamed-chunk-4-1.png" style="display: block; margin: auto;" />

# etc functions

## `trim()` function


```r
trim("  Wow!  ", method="trailing")
```

```
## [1] "  Wow!"
```

```r
trim("  Wow!  ", method="leading")
```

```
## [1] "Wow!  "
```

```r
"  Wow!  " %>% trim %>% trim(method="leading")
```

```
## [1] "Wow!"
```
